summary: This is a Law360 White Collar newsletter from March 30, 2021, summarizing multiple legal news stories. The most relevant item for the Epstein case is an update stating Ghislaine Maxwell was hit with new child sex trafficking charges for the first time, alleging she recruited and paid a 14-year-old victim. The newsletter also covers unrelated stories about Toyota, Steven Donziger, and other legal matters.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused of grooming underage girls for sex with Jeffrey Epstein and newly charged with child sex trafficking for allegedly recruiting and paying a 14-year-old victim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the late financier for whom Maxwell allegedly groomed underage girls.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of grooming underage girls for sex with Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell Hit with New Child Sex Trafficking Charges
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on new child sex trafficking charges for the first time, alleging she recruited and paid a 14-year-old victim.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell faced new child sex trafficking charges for the first time in March 2021.
The new indictment alleged Maxwell recruited and paid a 14-year-old victim.
Maxwell was previously accused of grooming underage girls for sex with the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.
